intro: Carlina corymbosa f. macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed cudweed, is a variant of the cudweed species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its showy, daisy-like composite flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, and the leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture. The inflorescence consists of a central disk surrounded by ray florets, which are usually yellow or orange in color.
